question: Describe GARLIC (GWAS-based Prediction Toolkit for Connecting Diseases and Cell Types)
ideal_answer: GARLIC (GWAS-based Prediction Toolkit for Connecting Diseases and Cell Types) is a bioinformatic toolkit for aetiologically connecting diseases and cell type-specific regulatory maps. GARLIC can be used to retrieve potential disease-causative genetic variants overlapping regulatory sequences of interest. Overall, GARLIC can satisfy several important needs within the field of medical genetics, thus potentially assisting in the ultimate goal of uncovering the elusive and complex genetic basis of common human disorders.

snippets.text: GARLIC: a bioinformatic toolkit for aetiologically connecting diseases and cell type-specific regulatory maps.

Based on emerging evidences suggesting that disease-associated SNPs are frequently found within cell type-specific regulatory sequences, here we present GARLIC (GWAS-based Prediction Toolkit for Connecting Diseases and Cell Types), a user-friendly, multi-purpose software with an associated database and online viewer that, using global maps of cis-regulatory elements, can aetiologically connect human diseases with relevant cell types. Additionally, GARLIC can be used to retrieve potential disease-causative genetic variants overlapping regulatory sequences of interest. Overall, GARLIC can satisfy several important needs within the field of medical genetics, thus potentially assisting in the ultimate goal of uncovering the elusive and complex genetic basis of common human disorders.
